<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 94, 91]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 574, 92]]<|/det|> In this experiment, you will investigate how water cools. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 102, 876, 139]]<|/det|> The thermometers have been set up in the clamps for you. **Do not** adjust the heights of the thermometers. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 133, 576, 154]]<|/det|> Carry out the following instructions, referring to Fig. 2.1. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[180, 163, 769, 428]]<|/det|> <|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[442, 444, 509, 463]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 475, 144, 494]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 475, 180, 494]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 475, 875, 510]]<|/det|> Pour hot water into the beaker until it just covers the bulb of the upper thermometer. Do not stir the water for the rest of the experiment. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 515, 178, 534]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 515, 690, 535]]<|/det|> Wait for about 30 seconds before taking any measurements. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 540, 178, 559]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 540, 598, 559]]<|/det|> Start the stopclock and read both thermometers. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 555, 640, 575]]<|/det|> In the top row of Table 2.1, record these temperatures. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 580, 178, 599]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 580, 875, 615]]<|/det|> Record in the table the temperature \(\theta\) of each thermometer at 1 minute intervals until time \(t = 6\) minutes. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 622, 180, 640]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 622, 552, 640]]<|/det|> Complete the column headings in the table. <|ref|>table_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[435, 653, 515, 670]]<|/det|> Table 2.1 <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 680, 764, 925]]<|/det|>
